Key Match Events: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 93 runs and Shubman Gill scored a half-century, helping India win by 10 wickets.
Sikandar Raza led Zimbabwe to 152/7 with his performance.
India chased down 157 without losing a wicket and with 28 balls to spare.
Khaleel Ahmed and Tushar Deshpande picked crucial wickets for India.
Washington Sundar's Player-of-the-Match spell of 3/15 in the previous game was highlighted.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill mentioned the need to improve death bowling and announced Tushar Deshpande's debut.
Sikandar Raza emphasized the importance of quality game time and hoped for better performance from the top-three batsmen.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and highlighted the importance of contributions from everyone.
Sikandar Raza acknowledged fielding issues and emphasized the need for senior players to step up.
Washington Sundar expressed his happiness playing for the country and highlighted the pressure from the partnership between Myers and Madande.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was described as better for batting compared to previous games.
India's fielding was noted as poor during the match.
The body language of Zimbabwe players was down as India dominated the chase.
